title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This article mentions Fabio Giglietto as someone who studied the spread of COVID-19-related mis- and disinformation in Italy and discusses how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior. He is identified as an associate professor at the University of Urbino.
description: The article discusses Fabio Giglietto's research on the spread of COVID-19 misinformation in Italy and how actors respond to social media platform interventions, situating him within the context of disinformation studies.

title: DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS - Lecturer: Fabio Giglietto - A.Y. 2025/2026 - Uniurb
snippet: This page describes Fabio Giglietto's DIGITAL SOCIAL NETWORK ANALYSIS course for the academic year 2025/2026 at Uniurb. It outlines the course's goals, including providing students with an understanding of methodologies for analyzing digital social environments, data collection from the web and social media, and the use of R and Gephi software for data exploration.
description: This webpage from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo describes Fabio Giglietto's "Digital Social Network Analysis" course for the academic year 2025/2026, covering topics like methodologies for analyzing digital social environments and data collection from social media.

title: "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS"
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which demonstrated how META favored homophobic, racist, or fake news posts over content from politicians. This is presented as an example of how American Big Tech companies influence elections worldwide.
description: This YouTube video discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which found that META favored content like homophobic, racist, and fake news posts. This is presented as an example of Big Tech companies' influence on elections.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Cracking the code: social data access and the DSA's impact on disinformation research
snippet: Article by Massimo Terenzi and Fabio Giglietto discussing the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on social media research, particularly in the context of disinformation.
description: Article discussing the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on disinformation research, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi. The article explores the challenges and opportunities presented by the DSA for researchers studying social media and disinformation.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights
snippet: This report cites Fabio Giglietto's work on disinformation, defining it as deliberately false information intended to deceive, often for political or economic goals. It discusses the role of fake news in complex systems and its relationship to human rights struggles.
description: This report, "In the Shadows of Disinformation: Fake News and Violations of Human Rights," cites Fabio Giglietto's work on disinformation, discussing its definition and role in complex systems related to human rights.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team within the vera.ai project, coordinating Work Package 4 (WP4), which focuses on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article from vera.ai introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team, coordinating Work Package 4 (WP4) focused on detecting problematic content and coordinated sharing behavior. The content confirms Fabio Giglietto's involvement in a project related to disinformation and social media research at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo.
